result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement - requests furlough before jail time begins for purposes of business equipment and family affairs.

COURT ORDERS: 
15CM1641 - Ct. 1>>120 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 9 days of time already served to commence immediately, but after 5 days, if it is approved by PO, defendant may have 5 day furlough but only under the terms and conditions as set forth by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge
15CM1651 and 15CM1652>>Sentence W/held on all counts; 3 years probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to jail time in 15CM1641.
CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant has to complete 10 hours of c.s./week; CC including one D.A. surcharge; One DNA sample to be provided - One DNA surcharge in 15CM1651 and One DNA surcharge in 15CM1652.

>>In the event of revocation, 2 days credit in 15CM1651 and 3 days credit in 15CM1652
